Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 2, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
R 400.113 Employee records
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from MDHHS, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the country where
the person usually resides, that the person has not been
determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect.
the documentation shall be completed not more than 30 days
prior to the start of employment and every 12 months thereafter
Three of eight employees did not have a Central Registry
clearance either annually or prior to hire.
R 400.113 Employee records
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of two new employees did not have a performance
evaluation within 30 days of the probationary period.
R 400.4120 Supervisor of direct care workers; qualifications.
A supervisor of direct care workers shall have 1 of the following:
(a) A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
and 2 years of work experience in a child caring institution.
4

The supervisor of direct care workers (hired on 7/3/19) does not
meet the qualification requirements for the position. When hired,
she had a bachelor’s degree but no work experience in a child
caring institution. The agency did not seek DCWL consultation
prior to hiring her. In this instance I suggested the agency request
a variance.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose function
is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum of 50 clock
hours of planned training within the first year of employment and a
minimum of 25 clock hours of training annually thereafter related to
the employee’s job function. At least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the
first year shall be orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Two of six staff did not have 25 hours of training annually
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care,
all of the following information shall be documented in the
case record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the
services provided by the facility after discharge.
(c) An assessment of the residents needs that remain to
be met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
Discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations
including medical and dental follow up that is needed,
have been reviewed with the resident, parent and
responsible case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
5

One of three youth who had been discharged did not have a discharge plan.
2.) This is a non-MDHHS contracted facility and therefore not required to follow ISEP

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
To fully comply with R. 400.4166 Discharge plan, it was recommended the facility
develop a discharge instruction form to be completed at the time of discharge. I
provided them with a sample form that can be altered and used a template.
Discharge plans/instructions must be completed on all youth including those youth
with short term (respite) stays.
To comply with R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary
service plans, preliminary service plans must be developed for short-term (respite)
youth within 7 calendar days of admission. A preliminary service plan template will
need to be developed and utilized.
The agency must follow the same pre-hire and training requirements for any
employee who works at Genesis House, including those staff borrowed or transferred
from other Spectrum programs.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency is seeking to change the chief administrator/licensee designee from
Kimberly O’Neal to the program’s current associate director. The associate director has
a wealth of experience and is the most likely candidate. However, she does not meet
the minimum educational requirements of the rule. I recommended the agency request
a variance.
I provided a sample variance request with instructions on how to request a variance.
The new CAP form was provided to the agency. When they are ready, I will provide
consultation on how to complete the form.
6

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
I completed an unannounced walk-through of the facility on 9/4/20 and
interviewed staff and youth who were present. There were no issues. The
home was clean and nicely decorated. I checked kitchen cupboards,
bathrooms, bedrooms and refrigerator and freezer temperatures. I was unable
to complete a walk-through in Dec 2020 due to a recent report of a COVID+
staff.
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no DCWL investigations. Thus, the facility submitted no corrective
action plans during this licensing period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
